column4: I have a Nvidia Vanta graphics card, what is the proper way to install the best driver for it?
it doesn't list any drivers for me.
will that work for me? The version number for my card's driver at the Nvidia site is 71.86.14. My version number isn't listed on that page you linked to me.
the binary driver will work for your card.
did you get the link from ubottu?
sorry, I dissconected.....did you see the link i sent you?
yes did you get a private message from ubottu
yes i did. so this is my best option?: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
yes I would follow those directions.

so I followed the first step (removing nouveau by command line). Then it asked to open additional drivers, so I did and there still are no drivers available. So I moved to the next step, I have linux-headers-2.6.35-22-generic, linux-headers-2.6.35-22, linux-headers-generic & linux-libc-dev (development headers) installed. I could not find the linux-restricted-modules-XXX package in synaptic. What now?
basically install build-essentials and download the appropriate driver from nvidia.com  then run the script that you download. It will walk you through the install.
i search for "linux-restricted-modules" in synaptic and it found nothing.
so you mean to use the manual driver from nvidia?
